sentences.zh: 自古受命帝王，曷嘗不封禪？

translations.literal: From ancient times receive mandate emperor kings, what time not feng shan?
translations.idiomatic: From ancient times, what emperor who received the mandate did not perform the feng and shan sacrifices?

sentences.zh: 蓋有無其應而用事者矣，未有睹符瑞見而不臻乎泰山者也。

translations.literal: There have been those who performed the rites without the proper omens, but never those who saw auspicious signs appear and did not proceed to Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: There have been those who performed the sacrifices without awaiting the proper omens, but never those who witnessed auspicious signs without ascending Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 雖受命而功不至，至梁父矣而德不洽，洽矣而日有不暇給，是以即事用希。

translations.literal: Though they received the mandate, their achievements did not reach the required level; or reaching Liang Fu, their virtue was not in harmony; or being in harmony, they lacked the leisure time—so the rites were rarely performed.
translations.idiomatic: Though they received the mandate, their achievements fell short; reaching Liangfu, their virtue lacked harmony; being harmonious, they lacked sufficient leisure—so the rites were rarely performed.

sentences.zh: 傳曰：「三年不為禮，禮必廢；

translations.literal: Tradition says: 'three years not perform rites, rites must waste;
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says: 'Three years without performing the rites, the rites must fall into disuse;

sentences.zh: 三年不為樂，樂必壞。」

translations.literal: three years not perform music, music must ruin.'
translations.idiomatic: three years without performing music, the music must deteriorate.'

sentences.zh: 每世之隆，則封禪答焉，及衰而息。

translations.literal: Each generation's flourishing, then feng shan respond to it, and decline then cease.
translations.idiomatic: In each flourishing era, the feng and shan sacrifices respond to it; when it declines, they cease.

sentences.zh: 厥曠遠者千有餘載，近者數百載，故其儀闕然堙滅，其詳不可得而記聞云。

translations.literal: The distant ones were over a thousand years ago, the nearer ones several hundred years ago—therefore their rites have gaps and are buried in oblivion; their details cannot be obtained and recorded, it is said.
translations.idiomatic: The distant ones were more than a thousand years ago, the nearer ones several hundred years ago—therefore their ceremonies have gaps and are buried in oblivion; their details cannot be obtained and recorded.

sentences.zh: 《尚書》曰，舜在璇璣玉衡，以齊七政。

translations.literal: The Shang Shu says: Shun was at the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng, using them to align the seven governances.
translations.idiomatic: The Book of History says: Shun resided at the Jade Sieve and Jade Balance, using them to align the seven celestial governors.

sentences.zh: 遂類于上帝，禋于六宗，望山川，遍群神。

translations.literal: Then he offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made yin offerings to the six ancestors, gazed at the mountains and rivers, and universally to all spirits.
translations.idiomatic: Then he offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made fragrant offerings to the six ancestors, gazed upon the mountains and rivers, and universally honored all spirits.

sentences.zh: 輯五瑞，擇吉月日，見四嶽諸牧，還瑞。

translations.literal: He collected the five auspicious tokens, selected auspicious months and days, met with the four peak lords and all the shepherds, and returned the auspicious tokens.
translations.idiomatic: He collected the five auspicious tokens, selected auspicious months and days, met with the lords of the four sacred peaks and all the regional governors, and returned the tokens.

sentences.zh: 歲二月，東巡狩，至于岱宗。

translations.literal: In the year's second month, he conducted the eastern inspection tour, arriving at Dai Zong.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of the year, he conducted the eastern inspection tour, arriving at Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 岱宗，泰山也。

translations.literal: Dai Zong is Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: He climbed the mountain, built an earthen altar to sacrifice to heaven, and buried the tablets of the covenant.

sentences.zh: 柴，望秩于山川。

translations.literal: He performed the chai sacrifice, gazing in order at the mountains and rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He descended and leveled the earth for an altar to sacrifice to earth, transmitting the governance.

sentences.zh: 遂覲東后。

translations.literal: Then he held audience with the eastern lords.
translations.idiomatic: Those who performed the Feng and Shan were twenty-eight rulers, but I will not record them all.

sentences.zh: 東后者，諸侯也。

translations.literal: The eastern lords are the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Shun's Feng and Shan sacrifices were grand and elaborate, with ritual vessels and ceremonies appropriate to their achievements.

sentences.zh: 合時月正日，同律度量衡，修五禮，五玉三帛二生一死贄。

translations.literal: He harmonized the seasons, months, and first days; standardized the pitch pipes, measures, and balances; repaired the five rites; and prepared the five jades, three silks, two living animals, and one dead animal as tribute.
translations.idiomatic: Yu's Feng and Shan were simple and unadorned, with ritual vessels and ceremonies matching his frugal virtue.

sentences.zh: 五月，巡狩至南嶽。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the southern peak.
translations.idiomatic: The Feng and Shan of the Xia, Shang, and Zhou dynasties each followed their own precedents.

sentences.zh: 南嶽，衡山也。

translations.literal: The southern peak is Mount Heng.
translations.idiomatic: The Feng and Shan of the Xia dynasty used dark-colored robes and caps, simple and plain.

sentences.zh: 八月，巡狩至西嶽。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the western peak.
translations.idiomatic: The Feng and Shan of the Shang dynasty used white robes and caps, pure and bright.

sentences.zh: 西嶽，華山也。

translations.literal: The western peak is Mount Hua.
translations.idiomatic: The Feng and Shan of the Zhou dynasty used red robes and caps, brilliant and flourishing.

sentences.zh: 十一月，巡狩至北嶽。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, he conducted the inspection tour to the northern peak.
translations.idiomatic: The Feng and Shan of the Qin dynasty used black robes and caps, deep and solemn.

sentences.zh: 北岳，恒山也。

translations.literal: The northern peak is Mount Heng.
translations.idiomatic: Since the Qin unified the realm, the feng and shan ceremonies have been discontinued.

sentences.zh: 皆如岱宗之禮。

translations.literal: All like Dai Zong's rites.
translations.idiomatic: All were performed according to Dai Zong's rites.

sentences.zh: 中嶽，嵩高也。

translations.literal: The central peak is Mount Song Gao.
translations.idiomatic: When the realm was at peace, the Son of Heaven wished to perform the feng and shan sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 五載一巡狩。

translations.literal: Once every five years he conducted the inspection tour.
translations.idiomatic: He summoned scholars of the five classics to discuss the feng and shan ceremonies.

sentences.zh: 禹遵之。

translations.literal: Yu followed this practice.
translations.idiomatic: The scholars said: "The feng and shan ceremonies are rarely performed and long discontinued."

sentences.zh: 後十四世，至帝孔甲，淫德好神，神瀆，二龍去之。

translations.literal: Fourteen generations later, Emperor Kong Jia had licentious virtue and was fond of spirits; he profaned the spirits, so the two dragons left him.
translations.idiomatic: We examine the precedents of the ancient kings who performed feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 其後三世，湯伐桀，欲遷夏社，不可，作夏社。

translations.literal: Three generations later, Tang attacked Jie; he wished to move the Xia altar but it was not possible, so he made a Xia altar.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Liangfu.

sentences.zh: 後八世，至帝太戊，有桑谷生於廷，一暮大拱，懼。

translations.literal: Eight generations later, Emperor Tai Wu had mulberry and grain growing in his court; in one evening they grew to embrace each other greatly, causing fear.
translations.idiomatic: Yao performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Liangfu.

sentences.zh: 伊陟曰：「妖不勝德。」

translations.literal: Yi Zhi said: 'Demon not overcome virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi said: 'Demons cannot overcome virtue.'

sentences.zh: 太戊修德，桑谷死。

translations.literal: Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry and grain died.
translations.idiomatic: Yu performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 伊陟贊巫咸，巫咸之興自此始。

translations.literal: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, Wu Xian's rise from this began.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this.

sentences.zh: 後十四世，帝武丁得傅說為相，殷復興焉，稱高宗。

translations.literal: Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as his minister; Yin was revived thereupon, and he was called Gao Zong.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Zhou performed feng on Mount Tai, shan on Mount Sheshou.

sentences.zh: 有雉登鼎耳雊，武丁懼。

translations.literal: A pheasant ascended the cauldron's ears and crowed; Wu Ding was afraid.
translations.idiomatic: These were the precedents of the ancient sages.

sentences.zh: 祖己曰：「修德。」

translations.literal: Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the Han has unified the realm and pacified the barbarians.

sentences.zh: 武丁從之，位以永寧。

translations.literal: Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position was eternally peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: The realm is peaceful and the people prosperous.

sentences.zh: 後五世，帝武乙慢神而震死。

translations.literal: Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi disrespected the spirits and was killed by thunder.
translations.idiomatic: Auspicious omens appear and phoenixes arrive.

sentences.zh: 後三世，帝紂淫亂，武王伐之。

translations.literal: Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was licentious and chaotic; Wu Wang attacked him.
translations.idiomatic: This is the time to perform the feng and shan sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，始未嘗不肅祗，後稍怠慢也。

translations.literal: From this we can see that at the beginning they were never not solemn and respectful, but later they became somewhat negligent.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor consulted with his ministers about performing feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 周官曰，冬日至，祀天於南郊，迎長日之至；

translations.literal: Zhou officials say, winter solstice arrive, sacrifice heaven at south suburb, welcome long day arrive;

sentences.zh: 夏日至，祭地祗。

translations.literal: when the summer solstice arrives, sacrifice to the earth spirits.
translations.idiomatic: They must be performed when the realm is at peace and auspicious omens appear.

sentences.zh: 皆用樂舞，而神乃可得而禮也。

translations.literal: All use music and dance, and only then can the spirits be obtained and properly ritualized.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Han has unified the realm for sixty years.

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven sacrifices to all the famous mountains and great rivers under heaven: the five peaks are treated like the three dukes; the four rivers are treated like the feudal lords; the feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories.
translations.idiomatic: The realm is peaceful and the people are happy.

sentences.zh: 四瀆者，江、河、淮、濟也。

translations.literal: The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Auspicious omens appear frequently.

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.
translations.idiomatic: This is indeed the time for feng and shan.

translations.literal: After Duke Zhou assisted Cheng Wang, he performed the suburban sacrifice to Hou Ji to match with Heaven, and the ancestral sacrifice to Wen Wang in the Bright Hall to match with the Supreme Deity.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then decided to perform the feng and shan sacrifices.

translations.literal: Since Yu rose and repaired the altar sacrifices, and Hou Ji handled farming and harvesting, therefore there is the Ji temple; the suburban and altar sacrifices have come from ancient times.
translations.idiomatic: He sent officials to prepare Mount Tai for the ceremony.

translations.literal: From Zhou's conquest of Yin, after fourteen generations, each generation increasingly declined; rites and music were wasted; feudal lords conducted themselves unrestrainedly; You Wang was defeated by the Quan Rong; Zhou moved east to Luo city.

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began to be ranked among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The feng ceremony was performed on the summit of Mount Tai.

translations.literal: Qin Xiang Gong already marquis, dwelt west border, self considered master Shao Hao's spirit, made west zhi, sacrificed White Emperor, its sacrificial animals used sorrel colt yellow ox ram sheep each one says.
translations.idiomatic: After Qin Xiang Gong became marquis and dwelt on the western border, he considered himself master of Shao Hao's spirit, made the western zhi altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using as sacrificial animals one sorrel colt, one yellow ox, and one ram sheep each, it is said.

sentences.zh: 其後十六年，秦文公東獵汧渭之閒，卜居之而吉。

translations.literal: Sixteen years later, Qin Wen Gong went east hunting between the Qian and Wei rivers; he divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: The ceremony was grand and solemn.

translations.literal: Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The scholars all said: "The feng and shan ceremonies should be performed."

translations.literal: Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, Dun said: 'This Supreme Deity's omen, lord should sacrifice it.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is an omen from the Supreme Deity; my lord should sacrifice to it.'

sentences.zh: 於是作鄜畤，用三牲郊祭白帝焉。

translations.literal: Thereupon he made the Fu zhi altar, using three sacrificial animals to perform the suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor summoned the scholars to discuss the feng and shan ceremonies.

sentences.zh: 自未作鄜畤也，而雍旁故有吳陽武畤，雍東有好畤，皆廢無祠。

translations.literal: Before the Fu zhi was made, beside Yong there were originally the Wu Yang Wu zhi and east of Yong the Hao zhi, but all were abandoned without sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: They discussed the precedents and rituals of the ancient sages.

translations.literal: Some said: 'From ancient times with Yong province piled high, spirits bright recess, therefore established zhi suburb Supreme Deity, various spirits sacrifices all gathered cloud.
translations.idiomatic: Some say: 'From ancient times, Yong province has been piled high, a recess for spirits and brightness; therefore the zhi altars were established to suburb-sacrifice the Supreme Deity, and all the various spirit sacrifices gathered there as clouds.

sentences.zh: 蓋黃帝時嘗用事，雖晚周亦郊焉。」

translations.literal: Cover Yellow Emperor time once used affairs, though late Zhou also suburb there.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor once used these affairs, and even late Zhou also performed the suburban sacrifices there.'

sentences.zh: 其語不經見，縉紳者不道。

translations.literal: These words are not seen in the classics; officials do not speak of them.
translations.idiomatic: The scholars said: "The feng and shan ceremonies are the most important rites."

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後九年，文公獲若石雲，于陳倉北阪城祠之。

translations.literal: Nine years after making the Fu zhi, Wen Gong obtained something like a stone cloud; he walled it at the north slope of Chen Cang and sacrificed to it.
translations.idiomatic: They require great virtue and auspicious omens to perform.

sentences.zh: 其神或歲不至，或歲數來，來也常以夜，光輝若流星，從東南來集于祠城，則若雄雞，其聲殷雲，野雞夜雊。

translations.literal: Its spirit sometimes did not arrive for a year, sometimes came several times a year; when it came it was always at night, radiant like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrificial walled area, crowing like a male chicken with a rumbling sound like thunder, and wild chickens crowing at night.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor has unified the realm and pacified the people.

sentences.zh: 以一牢祠，命曰陳寶。

translations.literal: He sacrificed with one pen of sacrificial animals, naming it Chen Bao.
translations.idiomatic: Auspicious omens appear frequently.

sentences.zh: 作鄜畤後七十八年，秦德公既立，卜居雍，「後子孫飲馬於河」，遂都雍。

translations.literal: Made Fu zhi after seventy eight years, Qin De Gong already established, divined dwelling Yong, 'later descendants drink horses at river', then capitaled Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Seventy-eight years after making the Fu zhi, Qin De Gong was already established; he divined about dwelling in Yong: 'Later descendants will drink their horses at the river,' and then made Yong his capital.

sentences.zh: 雍之諸祠自此興。

translations.literal: Yong's various sacrifices from this rose.
translations.idiomatic: Yong's various sacrifices rose from this.

translations.idiomatic: The scholars agreed that the time was right for feng and shan.

sentences.zh: 作伏祠。

translations.idiomatic: He established the hidden sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 磔狗邑四門，以御蠱菑。

translations.idiomatic: He had dogs torn apart and walled them at the four gates, to resist poison and calamities.

sentences.zh: 德公立二年卒。

translations.literal: 其後四年，秦文公東獵汧渭之閒。
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Qin Wen Gong hunted east between the Qian and Wei rivers.

translations.literal: 卜居之而吉。
translations.idiomatic: He divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious.

sentences.zh: 而後世皆曰秦繆公上天。

translations.idiomatic: Before building the Fu zhi altar, Yong already had the Wu Yang Wu zhi nearby, and to the east there was the Hao zhi—all abandoned without sacrifices.

translations.idiomatic: Chu Xi performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 神農封泰山，禪云云；

translations.idiomatic: Shen Nong performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 炎帝封泰山，禪云云；

translations.idiomatic: The Yan Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 黃帝封泰山，禪亭亭；

translations.literal: Yellow Emperor feng Tai Mountain, shan Ting Ting;
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Ting Ting;

sentences.zh: 顓頊封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Zhuan Xu feng Tai Mountain, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Zhuan Xu performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun;

sentences.zh: 帝嚳封泰山，禪云云；

translations.literal: Emperor Ku feng Tai Mountain, shan Yun Yun;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Ku performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun;

translations.literal: He then made the Tong Tian Jing platform and placed sacrifice implements below it, intending to summon immortal and spirit people.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore later generations named the place Ding Lake, his bow Wu Hao.

translations.literal: Thereupon Gan Quan again placed the front hall and began broadening the various palace chambers.
translations.idiomatic: The Yellow Emperor gathered copper from Shou Mountain, cast tripods at the foot of Jing Mountain.

translations.literal: In summer, mushrooms were born in the hall room's inner midst.
translations.idiomatic: That summer, auspicious mushrooms sprouted inside the palace hall.

translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven for blocking the river raised the Tong Tian platform; as if he saw there was light, they say; he then issued an edict: 'Gan Quan room midst has born nine mushroom stems; amnesty all under heaven; no repeat work.'

sentences.zh: 其明年，伐朝鮮。

translations.literal: The next year, he attacked Chao Xian.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, he launched a campaign against Chosun.

sentences.zh: 夏，旱。

translations.idiomatic: That summer brought drought.

translations.literal: Gong Sun Qing said: 'Yellow Emperor time feng then heaven drought, dry feng three years.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Qing said: 'In Yellow Emperor's time when feng was performed then heaven had drought; dry feng three years.'

translations.idiomatic: We should command all under heaven to honor and sacrifice to the spirit star there.'

translations.literal: The next year, the emperor performed suburban sacrifice at Yong, opened the Hui Zhong way, and toured it.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the emperor performed the suburban sacrifice at Yong, opened the Huizhong road, and toured along it.

sentences.zh: 春，至鳴澤，從西河歸。

translations.literal: In spring, he arrived at Ming Ze and returned following the Xi He.
translations.idiomatic: In spring, he reached Mingze and returned following the Xibe River.

sentences.zh: 其明年冬，上巡南郡，至江陵而東。

translations.literal: The next year in winter, the emperor toured the Nan commandery, arrived at Jiang Ling and went east.
translations.idiomatic: The following winter, the emperor toured the Nanguan commandery, reaching Jiangling before heading east.

sentences.zh: 登禮灊之天柱山，號曰南岳。

translations.literal: He ascended and performed rites at Qian's Tian Zhu Mountain, styling it Nan Yue.
translations.idiomatic: He ascended and performed rites at Mount Tianzhu in the Shan region, proclaiming it the Southern Peak.

sentences.zh: 浮江，自尋陽出樅陽，過彭蠡，禮其名山川。

translations.literal: He floated on the Jiang, from Xun Yang exited at Cong Yang, passed Peng Li, and performed rites to its famous mountains and rivers.
translations.idiomatic: He sailed down the Yangtze, leaving from Xunyang at Congyang, passing Pengli Lake, and performing rites at its famous mountains and rivers.

sentences.zh: 北至瑯邪，并海上。

translations.literal: He arrived north at Lang Ye, following above the sea.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived north at Langye, following the coastline.

sentences.zh: 四月中，至奉高修封焉。

translations.literal: In the fourth month's midst, he arrived at Feng Gao and repaired the feng there.
translations.idiomatic: In mid-fourth month, he reached Fenggao and repaired the feng altar.

sentences.zh: 初，天子封泰山，泰山東北阯古時有明堂處，處險不敞。

translations.literal: Initially, when the Son of Heaven performed feng at Tai Mountain, Tai Mountain's northeast zi in ancient times had a bright hall place; the place was dangerous and not spacious.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, when the Son of Heaven performed the feng sacrifice on Mount Tai, the northeast slope had an ancient site for the Bright Hall, but it was dangerous and cramped.

sentences.zh: 上欲治明堂奉高旁，未曉其制度。

translations.literal: The emperor wished to repair the bright hall beside Feng Gao, but had not yet clarified its system and regulations.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor wished to build a Bright Hall beside Fenggao, but had not yet determined its proper design.

sentences.zh: 濟南人公玊帶上黃帝時明堂圖。

translations.literal: The Ji Nan man Gong Yu Dai presented a bright hall diagram from Yellow Emperor's time.
translations.idiomatic: A man from Jinan named Gong Yudai presented a diagram of the Bright Hall from the Yellow Emperor's era.

sentences.zh: 明堂圖中有一殿，四面無壁，以茅蓋，通水，圜宮垣為複道，上有樓，從西南入，命曰昆侖，天子從之入，以拜祠上帝焉。

translations.literal: The bright hall diagram had one hall in the midst, four sides without walls, covered with thatch, connected to water, round palace wall made into a covered way, above had a tower, entered from the southwest, named Kun Lun; the Son of Heaven followed it and entered, to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity there.
translations.idiomatic: The diagram showed a single hall in the center, open on all four sides with a thatched roof, surrounded by water, with a circular wall forming covered walkways. A tower rose above it, entered from the southwest and named Kunlun. The Son of Heaven entered following this design to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity.

sentences.zh: 於是上令奉高作明堂汶上，如帶圖。

translations.literal: Thereupon the emperor commanded Feng Gao to make the bright hall above Wen, like Dai's diagram.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then ordered Fenggao to construct a Bright Hall above the Wen River, following the diagram.

sentences.zh: 及五年修封，則祠太一、五帝於明堂上坐，令高皇帝祠坐對之。

translations.literal: And when five years later repairing the feng, then sacrificed to Tai Yi and the five emperors at the bright hall's upper seat, commanded Gao emperor's sacrifice seat to face it.
translations.idiomatic: Five years later, when repairing the feng sacrifice, he sacrificed to Taiyi and the Five Emperors at the upper seat of the Bright Hall, with Gaozu's sacrificial seat facing them.

sentences.zh: 祠后土於下房，以二十太牢。

translations.literal: Sacrificed to Hou Tu at the lower chamber, with twenty tai lao.
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed to Houtu in the lower chamber with twenty sets of grand sacrificial victims.

sentences.zh: 天子從昆侖道入，始拜明堂如郊禮。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven followed the Kun Lun way and entered, began bowing to the bright hall like suburban rites.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven entered via the Kunlun passage, beginning to bow at the Bright Hall in the manner of suburban rites.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，燎堂下。

translations.literal: The rites completed, liao burned below the hall.
translations.idiomatic: The rites completed, the sacrificial fire was lit below the hall.

sentences.zh: 而上又上泰山，自有祕祠其巔。

translations.literal: And the emperor again ascended Tai Mountain, himself having a secret sacrifice at its peak.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor then ascended Mount Tai again, conducting a private sacrifice at its summit.

sentences.zh: 而泰山下祠五帝，各如其方，黃帝并赤帝，而有司侍祠焉。

translations.literal: And below Tai Mountain sacrificed to the five emperors, each according to their direction; the Yellow Emperor combined with the Red Emperor, and the officials served the sacrifice there.
translations.idiomatic: Below the mountain, sacrifices were made to the Five Emperors, each in their proper direction. The Yellow Emperor was combined with the Red Emperor, with officials attending the ceremonies.

sentences.zh: 山上舉火，下悉應之。

translations.literal: Above the mountain raised fire, below all responded to it.
translations.idiomatic: Fires were lit on the mountain top, with all below responding in kind.

sentences.zh: 其後二歲，十一月甲子朔旦冬至，推歷者以本統。

translations.literal: Two years later, in the eleventh month Jia Zi new moon dawn winter solstice, the calendar pushers used the original system.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, on the jiazi day of the eleventh month's new moon and winter solstice dawn, the calendar officials followed the original system.

sentences.zh: 天子親至泰山，以十一月甲子朔旦冬至日祠上帝明堂，毋修封禪。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven personally arrived at Tai Mountain, on the eleventh month Jia Zi new moon dawn winter solstice day sacrificed to the Supreme Deity at the bright hall, without repairing feng shan.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven personally arrived at Mount Tai, sacrificing to the Supreme Deity at the Bright Hall on the eleventh month's jiazi new moon winter solstice dawn, without repairing the feng and shan.

translations.literal: He arrived east above the sea; examined those who entered the sea and method masters who sought spirits; none were verified, however he increased dispatches, hoping to encounter them.
translations.idiomatic: He traveled east to the seacoast, examining those who ventured into the sea and the fangshi seeking spirits. None proved genuine, yet he sent out more expeditions, hoping for success.

sentences.zh: 十一月乙酉，柏梁災。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month Yi You, the Cypress Beam had a disaster.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, on the yiyou day, the Cypress Beam Palace suffered a fire.

sentences.zh: 十二月甲午朔，上親禪高里，祠后土。

translations.literal: On the twelfth month Jia Wu new moon, the emperor personally performed shan at Gao Li, sacrificing to Hou Tu.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiawu new moon of the twelfth month, the emperor personally performed the shan sacrifice at Gaoli, offering to Houtu.

translations.idiomatic: Facing the Bohai Sea, he was about to gaze in sacrifice toward the Penglai islands, hoping to reach their transcendent courts.

sentences.zh: 上還，以柏梁災故，朝受計甘泉。

translations.literal: The emperor returned; because of the Cypress Beam disaster, he received tallies in the morning at Gan Quan.
translations.idiomatic: On his return, due to the Cypress Beam fire, he held court at Ganquan Palace to receive the annual accounts.

translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Qing said: 'The Yellow Emperor approached the Qing Ling Platform; twelve days it burned; the Yellow Emperor then repaired the bright court.

translations.idiomatic: The bright court was Gan Quan.'

translations.idiomatic: The fangshi often claimed that ancient emperors and kings had capitals at Ganquan.

translations.idiomatic: Afterward, the Son of Heaven again received the feudal lords at Ganquan, where mansions were built for them.

translations.idiomatic: Thus he built the Jianzhang Palace, designed with a thousand gates and ten thousand chambers.

translations.literal: The front hall was measured as high as Wei Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Its front hall was as tall as the Weiyang Palace.

translations.literal: To the east was the Phoenix Tower, over twenty zhang high.
translations.idiomatic: To the east stood the Phoenix Tower, over twenty zhang high.

sentences.zh: 其西則唐中，數十里虎圈。

translations.literal: To the west was Tangzhong, with tiger enclosures spanning several dozen li.
translations.idiomatic: To the west was the Tangzhong enclosure, with tiger pens spanning several dozen li.

translations.literal: To the north, he had a large pool excavated, with a pavilion over twenty zhang high, named Taiye Pool. Within it were Penglai, Fangzhang, Yingzhou, and Hulu islands, modeled after the divine mountains and turtles and fish in the sea.
translations.idiomatic: To the north, a great pool was dug with a pavilion over twenty zhang high, named Taiye Pool. Within it were islands representing Penglai, Fangzhang, Yingzhou, and Hulushan, modeled after the divine mountains, turtles, and fish of the sea.

sentences.zh: 其南有玉堂、璧門、大鳥之屬。

translations.literal: To the south were the Jade Hall, the Jade Gate, and structures shaped like great birds.
translations.idiomatic: To the south stood the Jade Hall, the Jade Gate, and structures shaped like great birds.

translations.idiomatic: That summer, the Han reformed the calendar, making the first month the start of the year, with yellow as the ruling color. Official titles and seal characters were changed using five characters, marking the first year of the Taichu era.

translations.idiomatic: That year, they campaigned west against Dayuan.

translations.literal: A great locust plague arose.
translations.idiomatic: A massive locust plague erupted.

translations.literal: Lady Ding, Yu Chu of Luo Yang, and others used methods to sacrifice and curse the Xiongnu and Da Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Lady Ding, Yu Chu of Luoyang, and others used occult methods to sacrifice and curse the Xiongnu and Dayuan.

sentences.zh: 其明年，有司上言雍五畤無牢熟具，芬芳不備。

translations.literal: The next year, the officials presented a memorial that Yong's five zhi lacked lao and ripe equipment, and fragrant fragrances were not prepared.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, officials reported that Yong's five altars lacked proper sacrificial victims and fragrant offerings.

sentences.zh: 乃令祠官進畤犢牢具，色食所勝，而以木禺馬代駒焉。

translations.literal: Then he commanded the sacrifice officials to advance calf lao equipment for the zhi, with colors and foods that conquered, and used wooden yu horses to substitute for colts.

translations.idiomatic: Only in the fifth month did they taste the colts; for the emperor's personal suburban sacrifice, live colts were used.

translations.literal: And for all the famous mountains and rivers that used colts, they all substituted wooden yu horses.
translations.idiomatic: For all other famous mountains and rivers that required colts, wooden horses were substituted.

sentences.zh: 行過，乃用駒。

translations.literal: When the performance was over, then they used colts.
translations.idiomatic: Only after the ceremony was complete were live colts used.

sentences.zh: 他禮如故。

translations.literal: Other rites were as before.
translations.idiomatic: All other rites remained unchanged.

sentences.zh: 其明年，東巡海上，考神僊之屬，未有驗者。

translations.literal: The next year, he toured east above the sea, examining the spirit immortals and their kind, but there were none who had been verified.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, touring east along the seacoast, he examined the spirit immortals, but found none who could be verified.

sentences.zh: 方士有言「黃帝時為五城十二樓，以候神人於執期，命曰迎年」。

translations.literal: Method masters had words 'Yellow Emperor time made five cities twelve towers, with awaited spirit people at Holding Period, named Welcoming Year'.
translations.idiomatic: The method masters said: 'In the Yellow Emperor's time they made five cities and twelve towers, to await spirit people at the Holding Period, named Welcoming Year.'

sentences.zh: 上許作之如方，命曰明年。

translations.literal: The emperor permitted making it according to the method, naming it Welcoming Year.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor approved building it according to the method, naming it the Welcoming Year.

sentences.zh: 上親禮祠上帝焉。

translations.literal: The emperor personally performed rites and sacrificed to the Supreme Deity there.

sentences.zh: 公玊帶曰：「黃帝時雖封泰山，然風后、封巨、岐伯令黃帝封東泰山，禪凡山，合符，然後不死焉。」

translations.literal: Gong Yu Dai said: 'Yellow Emperor time although feng Tai Mountain, however Feng Hou, Feng Ju, Qi Bo commanded Yellow Emperor feng East Tai Mountain, shan Fan Mountain, united tally, then not died there.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Yu Dai said: 'Although in the Yellow Emperor's time they performed feng at Tai Mountain, Feng Hou, Feng Ju, and Qi Bo commanded the Yellow Emperor to perform feng at East Tai Mountain, shan at Fan Mountain, unite the tally, and only then would he not die.'

sentences.zh: 天子既令設祠具，至東泰山，［東］泰山卑小，不稱其聲，乃令祠官禮之，而不封禪焉。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven had already commanded the setting up of sacrifice equipment, arrived at East Tai Mountain; East Tai Mountain was low and small, not matching its reputation, so he commanded the sacrifice officials to perform rites to it, but did not perform feng shan there.

sentences.zh: 其後令帶奉祠候神物。

translations.literal: Afterwards he commanded Dai to serve the sacrifice and await spirit things.

sentences.zh: 夏，遂還泰山，修五年之禮如前，而加以禪祠石閭。

translations.literal: In summer, he then returned to Tai Mountain, performed the five-year rites like before, and added a shan sacrifice at Stone Gate.

sentences.zh: 石閭者，在泰山下阯南方，方士多言此僊人之閭也，故上親禪焉。

translations.literal: Stone Gate was at Tai Mountain's lower zi in the south; the method masters often said this was the gate of the immortal people, therefore the emperor personally performed shan there.

sentences.zh: 其後五年，復至泰山修封。

translations.literal: Five years later, he again arrived at Tai Mountain and repaired the feng.

sentences.zh: 還過祭恒山。

translations.literal: On his return he passed by and sacrificed at Heng Mountain.

sentences.zh: 今天子所興祠，太一、后土，三年親郊祠，建漢家封禪，五年一修封。

translations.literal: Now the sacrifices established by the Son of Heaven were Tai Yi and Hou Tu; every three years he personally performed suburban sacrifices, established the Han house feng shan, and every five years once repaired the feng.

sentences.zh: 薄忌太一及三一、冥羊、馬行、赤星，五，寬舒之祠官以歲時致禮。

translations.literal: Bo Ji Tai Yi and the Three Ones, Dark Sheep, Horse Travel, Red Star—five in total—Kuan Shu's sacrifice officials presented rites according to the seasons of the year.

sentences.zh: 凡六祠，皆太祝領之。

translations.literal: Altogether six sacrifices, all were led by the Grand Blessing.

sentences.zh: 至如八神諸神，明年、凡山他名祠，行過則祠，行去則已。

translations.literal: As for the eight spirits and various spirits, Welcoming Year, Fan Mountain and other named sacrifices, when he traveled past them he sacrificed, when he traveled on he stopped.

sentences.zh: 方士所興祠，各自主，其人終則已，祠官不主。

translations.literal: The sacrifices established by method masters, each was self-managed; when the person ended, then it stopped; the sacrifice officials did not manage them.

sentences.zh: 他祠皆如其故。

translations.literal: Other sacrifices were all as before.

sentences.zh: 今上封禪，其後十二歲而還，遍於五岳、四瀆矣。

translations.literal: Now the emperor performed feng shan; twelve years later he returned, having been universal to the five peaks and four waterways.

sentences.zh: 而方士之候祠神人，入海求蓬萊，終無有驗。

translations.literal: And the method masters who awaited and sacrificed to spirit people, entered the sea seeking Peng Lai, but in the end none had verification.

sentences.zh: 而公孫卿之候神者，猶以大人之跡為解，無有效。

translations.literal: And Gong Sun Qing's spirit-awaiters still used the tracks of great persons as explanations, but none had any effect.

sentences.zh: 天子益怠厭方士之怪迂語矣，然羈縻不絕，冀遇其真。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven increasingly grew weary and disgusted with the method masters' strange and circuitous words, however he kept them restrained but not cut off, hoping to encounter their true ones.

sentences.zh: 自此之後，方士言神祠者彌眾，然其效可睹矣。

translations.literal: From this time afterwards, the method masters who spoke of spirit sacrifices became increasingly many, however their effects could be clearly seen.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余從巡祭天地諸神名山川而封禪焉。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I followed toured sacrificed heaven earth various spirits famous mountains rivers and feng shan there.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I followed along as we toured and sacrificed to the heaven, earth, various spirits, famous mountains and rivers, and performed feng shan there.

sentences.zh: 入壽宮侍祠神語，究觀方士祠官之意，於是退而論次自古以來用事於鬼神者，具見其表裏。

translations.literal: I entered the Longevity Palace and served the sacrifice spirit words; I thoroughly observed the intentions of the method masters and sacrifice officials; thereupon I withdrew and arranged in order those who had used matters with ghosts and spirits from ancient times onward, fully seeing their exterior and interior.

sentences.zh: 後有君子，得以覽焉。

translations.literal: Afterwards, superior men could obtain to view it there.

sentences.zh: 若至俎豆珪幣之詳，獻酬之禮，則有司存。

translations.literal: If it comes to the details of zu, dou, gui, and bi, the rites of xian and chou, then the officials preserve them.
